body: +1. Please use HAWQ-146. Remember to push apache-hawq and the ivy.xml at the same time.
@xinzweb could you take a quick look?
This change has been merged and here is the commit id : 0ec66d57d6cb8c06037e4a3fbb4daca4b533c9df
+1 The code changes are ok to me.
The fix looks good to me. +1

This fix the syntax error but did not fix 'make distprep' option,  we might enable distprep option in the future. So this fix is okay.

The only issue is the commit message, we should follow the format. Please update the commit message before we merge it in. Thanks.

For example:
"HAWQ-224. Fix syntax error of make distprep."
CI passed. Manually tested on centos7. +1
@hsyuan, are you a committer of hawq? If not I will help you merge this.

no, I am not a committer.

Thanks~
Haisheng Yuan

On Thu, Dec 10, 2015 at 11:27 AM, Entong Shen notifications@github.com
wrote:

> @hsyuan https://github.com/hsyuan, are you a committer of hawq? If not
> I will help you merge this.
> 
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/incubator-hawq/pull/110#issuecomment-163725759
> .
What about the optimizer_control GUC mentioned in the Jira? It should be removed as well.

Removed code looks good.
+0.5 (waiting for the warning message code)

@wangzw We are bringing the ivy settings related to Orca inside apache, since the translator changes and version update always go hand in hand. By doing so we don't need to push to both repos for every refresh of Orca. Saves us tons of time.

@entong, optimizer_control is neither defined nor referenced in hawq code base. The only thing needs to be done is removing optimizer_control from HAWQ 2.0 doc. This is tracked by doc team's story and they are working on it.
Thanks! This is a small step on the way to open source Orca.
+1 The code change is ok to me
+1 The code changes look good to me.
